intro: Trigonochloa, commonly known as the spike grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. These plants are characterized by their slender, cylindrical stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. They are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in wetland or marshy habitats. Trigonochloa species usually have narrow leaves and produce small, wind-pollinated flowers. Their ecological role includes stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
